definition: to fit/suitable/proper/just (now)/comfortable/well/to go/to follow or pursue

sentences.english: But this year I choose on the windowsill, obtained a leisurely.
sentences.chinese: 但今年我卻選擇獨倚窗臺，求得一點閒適。

sentences.english: The carefree are apt to handle the unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 閒適自在的人，最善於處理人生的驚變。

sentences.english: These photos capture some of the most tranquil and relaxing paradises on Earth.
sentences.chinese: 這些照片拍攝下了地球上一些最安謐最閒適的天堂。

sentences.english: Night time is when the people of Barcelona most participate in the city's leisure activities.
sentences.chinese: 他們大多是在晚上盡情享受這種閒適的生活。

sentences.english: Leisure is being allowed to do nothing. —G. K. Chesterton.
sentences.chinese: 閒適就是允許你不做任何時情。

sentences.english: Enjoy beautiful with quiet and leisure.
They are constructed in a style of euphemism so as to convey the creative sense of leisure and ease.
sentences.chinese: 構建方式是用“娓語體”傳達創作主體的閒適與隨意。

sentences.english: Chapter Four proposes the attitude we should hold towards leisure reading matter.
sentences.chinese: 闡述我們對於中學生閒適讀物閱讀所應持有的態度。

sentences.english: We would no longer tolerate a situation in which the minority had leisure because the majority had labor.
sentences.chinese: 我們不能忍受少數人享受閒適因爲大多數人必須勞作。

sentences.english: It shows essayists' pursuit of wisdom in a humorous and refined style.
sentences.chinese: 構建風格爲在趣味性裏蘊含閒適文人的智性追求。

sentences.english: Accidentally, hope heaven emanates leisurely clouds scud across the artistic conception.
sentences.chinese: 去留無意，望天上雲捲雲舒的閒適意境。

definition: to stand aloof from worldly affairs
lit. heart untroubled, spirit pleased (idiom); carefree and relaxed
to return to one's true self/to regain the natural state
simple and unadorned (of art, architecture etc)
refined and elegant attitude of mind
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
